channel.title: Avery's Data Blog
channel.description: Recent content on Avery's Data Blog

item.title: Face Recognition and Single Value Decomposition (SVD)
item.description: For this project, I investigate how much I can reduce the storage space needed to store a black-and-white photo of my face still have Appleâ€™s facial recognition system recognize me! I will be using Single Value Decomposition to reduce a photo to a lower-rank matrix of grey pixel values that can be stored in a fraction of the space as the original photo. In order to process this image using Single Value Decomposition (SVD), I need to make it black and white by setting each pixel value to the average over its RGB values.

item.title: World Happiness EDA
item.description: TL;DR Wealth, social support, and life expectancy all seem to correlate strongly with happiness across countries. Corruption appears to correlate negatively with happiness, though outliers exist. Generosity does not seem to correlate with happiness at all, though the proxy for generosity (donating to a charity within the last month) seems ill-adapted to capture the kinds of informal help offered between members of distinct communities that dominate poorer and politically fragile countries.

My name is Avery Rogers, and I’m a student at Stanford University completing my MS in computer science and BA in economics. I’m fascinated by the world of data and statistics and am actively seeking a job in data science and analytics. My favorite package suite is R’s tidyverse ecosystem, and most of my work is done there. When I’m not coding, I love going for night runs around the Stanford campus, getting overly competitive in team sports, and singing while playing amateur guitar.
